question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's death prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday or will he cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if either (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if neither condition is met.

Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday, or will he no longer hold the position of President before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves YES if either (a) there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being the US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if neither of these scenarios occurs.

Note: A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 presidential election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf to request an early resolution or report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory rise in the coming week based on Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's probability of winning rises in the upcoming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly issues a clear and official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

(b) Is there a likelihood that Kamala Harris's chances of winning will improve in the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis? This will be considered Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be considered No otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It exclusively addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Donald Trump will be disqualified or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prohibition must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these scenarios are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. It is important to note that this question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. This condition is exclusively based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is announced as the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher total of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Standings at the 2024 Paris Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the United States Olympic Team is the (sole) highest positioned team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team attains a ranking that is higher or equal to that of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and arranging them according to:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In cases of ties at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In cases of ties at 2) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals, or (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, or (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. For part (b), the medal table is calculated by ordering countries by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals.

The resolution will be uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027. For part (b), the medal standings are determined by ranking countries based on the count of Gold Medals first, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prohibited from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prohibited from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prohibited from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified from any primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or that Ted Cruz will emerge as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been taken off any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A significant number of House Democrats are coordinating efforts to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the crucial ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and somehow force unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This involves Democrats organizing a plan to speak out against their party's effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than planned. A drafted letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) indicates that many Democrats are unsettled about Biden’s candidacy. This resolves to YES if such a letter, or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures, is signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. According to the New York Times, if by midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the early nomination of Biden, or (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats from either the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the early nomination of Biden. This entails Democrats coordinating efforts to oppose their party's move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than expected. A letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) suggests that numerous Democrats are concerned about Biden’s candidacy. This will be considered YES if such a letter, or several letters collectively bearing 20 signatures, is signed by the end of Sunday, July 21st. If not, it will be NO.

(b) If 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to withdraw before July 20, according to the New York Times, it will be YES if by midnight July 20 Central Time it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators have asked Biden to step aside. If this does not occur, it will be NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" in this context means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The outcome remains positive even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one letter would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will be marked YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or it might occur through a group meeting with Biden where they collectively request him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Reports involving any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and urging him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the presidency?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be answered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

To achieve a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the resolution will be No.

Further details and context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its resolution will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before July 15, 2024? (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th (b) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this condition unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens prior to July 15, 2024? (a) A coalition of at least five specified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators urges Biden to withdraw by July 20th (b) Joe Biden declares that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition consisting of no fewer than five identified members of the Democratic Party from the US House of Representatives or US Senate collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could take the form of a signed letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively persuade him to step aside. All five members must be part of the same communication effort. Reports regarding any number of unnamed Democrats appealing to Biden to resign will not meet this requirement unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before this market's closing date.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Belgium set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Belgium takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Latvia or Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Latvia nor Belgium qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Latvia or Belgium make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Belgium competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Latvia nor Belgium advances, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any moment before midnight July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators are present, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if a debate occurs involving possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024 (b) There is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, 2024 (b) Another Democratic presidential debate takes place prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it true that 10 or more Democratic Senators will request Biden to withdraw before July 20, 2024? The resolution source is: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators noted at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

(b) Will another debate for the Democratic presidential candidates occur? This will resolve to YES if a debate is held featuring potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will resolve to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Are Kamala's chances of victory expected to rise in the coming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be deemed NO if it does not.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed with a “yes” when the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

This will be confirmed with a “no” when the Democratic delegates choose a man as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will either Kamala's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model or the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Kamala's odds of winning will increase according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a Woman: Resolves YES if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves NO if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris's chances of winning according to Nate Silver's model improve, or will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Nominee in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Kamala Harris's chances of winning will improve based on Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise. Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) A Woman will be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024: Resolves YES if/when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024. Resolves NO if/when the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential nomination in 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Democratic Party to choose a Woman as their Nominee for President in 2024?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates opt for a female candidate as the presidential nominee for the upcoming election in 2024.

This will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates select a male candidate as the presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) The Democratic Party's candidate for President in 2024 is a woman?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be considered NO.

(b) This will be deemed “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It will be deemed “no” if and when a male candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Ireland fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Luxembourg going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. In all other scenarios, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Ireland or Luxembourg make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Ireland competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Luxembourg competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Ireland nor Luxembourg qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

para_P.title: Is Taylor Swift set to make an appearance in Deadpool and Wolverine?
para_P.body: This will be considered a YES if she is featured in the film in any capacity, including just her voice being utilized for a character. It will still be a YES even if she is not listed on IMDB, provided there is confirmation from independent sources.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Will the crossover film featuring Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film? [in comparison to Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, directed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its opening weekend. This would establish a new record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the highest R-rated opening in history.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new release surpass these figures? It is likely to be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a massive success at the time, and somewhat unexpected.

Since BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends -- it shows the raw figures but aggregates them oddly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to confirm what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the numbers from BoxOfficeMojo should be considered unofficial until there is a confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the target figure we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will either Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine or will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This resolves YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, including voice roles, even if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources.

(b) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The previous record is $284.5 million held by the original Deadpool.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Taylor Swift will make a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, or that Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body:
This is considered TRUE if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Taylor Swift is featured in the film "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any capacity, including voice roles, even if her involvement is not listed on IMDB, provided it is verified by independent sources.

(b) "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend, as reported, and is recognized by the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar outlet) as the highest-grossing opening for an R-rated film. The previous record stands at $284.5 million, held by the original Deadpool.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is picked by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks about potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*, with the indictments needing to take place before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and is not affected by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if either of the following takes place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) and is independent of who is nominated on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any remarks concerning possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name going to be part of the list of sanctioned candidates for the presidency by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the list of eligible presidential candidates approved by Iran's Guardian Council for the forthcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before May 1, 2024: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (b) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as an approved presidential candidate?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens prior to May 1, 2024: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed as an approved candidate by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault attributed to Israel, occurring within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the deaths of no fewer than five people. (b) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council's roster of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election in Iran.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia gain dominance over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the location is not classified under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian dominance over the area.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users with a reasonable level of trust are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or report any issues.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus. Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. para_P.title: By June 1, 2024, will Russia have taken control of Chasiv Yar, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if one of the following takes place:

1. On June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of these classifications:
   - Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
   - Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Evaluated Russian Control
   - Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance of the area.

   The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the site is not classified in any of the categories that suggest Russian control, including but not limited to:
   - Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Documented Ukrainian Partisan Actions
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian control.

2. Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, remain under the control of the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources confirm that a candidate from the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, a statement or source from Ohio State will be utilized. If there is no election conducted prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district during the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public statement indicating that he will not run and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the 2024 election. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will be answered as No.

(b) Is it likely that the Republican Party will keep Ohio's 6th congressional district (which was previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This will be answered as Yes if reliable sources confirm that a candidate representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. If there is a dispute among popular sources, a statement from an Ohio State source will be used to resolve it. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, the question will be considered void.
