question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament representing any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome will be **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak stands as a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding part (a), the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; the determination is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), the question will resolve to **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not achieve election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. Conversely, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is contesting in any constituency).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but no greater than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the graph for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number indicates Trump is in the lead, while a negative number signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 in the 538 national polling average, or will Joe Biden declare prior to that date that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and does not go beyond 3, based on the chart reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that Biden will not run and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to serve as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise no longer holds the office before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to continue as President until the end of July 2024, or for Trump to be disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as "Yes" if any of the following happens:

(a) Biden stays in office as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (for instance, appointing his Vice President as Acting President) will not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is considered distinct from the President under the Constitution.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties applicable to the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five specific Democratic House Representatives or Senators persuade Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would urge Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve to YES if a group of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter like the one mentioned above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden and collectively asking him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same coordinated message. If five individuals independently express to the media their belief that Biden should withdraw, it will not count as a YES.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases of ambiguity where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either the EU announce tariffs on Chinese EVs by July 5, 2024, or at least 5 Dem House Members/Senators urge Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats asking Biden to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO unless confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the EU will either declare tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles by July 5, 2024, or that at least five Democratic House Members or Senators will call on Biden to withdraw from the race by July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following takes place:

(a) Prior to July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has instituted new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time), a collective of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to request that Joe Biden consider stepping down from his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so. This could occur through signing a letter or through a group discussion with Biden in person where they collectively ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Merely five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate. Reports of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to step aside will not meet the criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the deadline. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will lean towards NO unless confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This query is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly occupied by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be consulted. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (2) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Credible sources must report this outcome, and if there is disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (1) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if either of the following takes place: (1) Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who is nominated on election day. (2) A candidate from the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Reliable sources must confirm this result, and in case of any disputes, an official statement or source from Ohio will be referenced. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this segment of the question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, regarding his refusal to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the declaration must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt about Biden's intention to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The determining source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology that FiveThirtyEight employs to calculate its data will not influence the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data points for July 20 are released. The resolution of this market may be delayed until the July 20 data points are available. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution will occur according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available, or by July 22 if no datapoints for July 19 are available. If their chances are equal, the resolution will be 50-50. The decision will be made based on the data points from July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is available, or by July 22 if no data for July 19 is present. (b) Kamala Harris declares her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. This part will be resolved as NO if she selects anyone else as her running mate. A confirmation from Kamala herself is necessary for resolution.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: During the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, will the winning time for the men's 100-meter sprint surpass the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Competitors Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Competitors together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Competitors have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will resolve to "Yes" immediately.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for the gold medals will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes". If neither of these events occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: During the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, will the men's 100-meter sprint either surpass the Olympic record or will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve at least 15 gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results from the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The official medal count published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) will serve as the resolution source for the gold medals, or other trustworthy sources if IOC reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes". If neither of these scenarios occurs, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be inaugurated as president by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala Harris become President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, or will Joe Biden cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting. (b) Joe Biden ceases to be President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET), due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Note that a temporary transfer of power to make his VP the Acting President under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this purpose.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to assume the role of President or Acting President prior to July 26, 2024, or for Joe Biden to no longer hold the presidency before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if either of the following takes place: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on authoritative information from the US government or a collective of reliable news sources. (b) Joe Biden is no longer the President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET), due to resignation, death, or any other circumstance. It is important to note that a temporary delegation of authority to appoint his Vice President as Acting President under the 25th amendment does not qualify as ceasing to be President for this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Vice President for the Democratic Party?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination as the Democratic Vice President, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if another individual is chosen for the VP position, this market will conclude with a no. Changes to the VP after the original nomination, for any reason, will not affect the outcome of this market. The market can finalize right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Larry Elder going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will yield a **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 presidential election; the determination is exclusively based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee, or (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Kamala Harris will be the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate, or (b) Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. If another individual is appointed as VP, the outcome will be **No**. Any changes to the VP after the initial selection will not affect the resolution of this question. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if Larry Elder is named the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The resolution of this question is **Yes** if the competitor who achieves the greatest tally of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in the swimming competitions.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

In any other scenario, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions, leading to a resolution of **Yes**.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if the athlete with the highest number of gold medals does not compete in swimming and women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to achieve the highest number of gold medals, or for the same country to secure victories in more than one women's team event at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The competitor who earns the most gold medals in the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The answer will be **No** if the competitor with the highest gold medal count does not take part in swimming and if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs each win gold in the eight team sports.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, as of July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's, based on the data from Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identifiable Democratic House Representatives or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to think about terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of a unified group message. If five individuals independently inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied prior to July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either Nvidia's market cap be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, or will at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message for this criterion to be met.

para_P.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization surpass that of Apple, or will a minimum of five identified Democratic lawmakers advocate for Biden to withdraw his candidacy prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if either of the following takes place: (a) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) A collective of at least five specified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate stepping down from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through signing a letter or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person. All five members must be included in the same group communication for this condition to be satisfied.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

Conversely, if a different individual is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not alter the resolution of this market. The market may resolve right after the nomination takes place.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris receives the nomination as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden makes a declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This declaration must be clear, public, official, unambiguous, and final.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee. The outcome is determined by the original nomination and will remain unchanged even if the Vice President is substituted for any reason after the nomination.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude positively if France finishes in the top 5 (ties will also conclude positively) at the Olympic Games occurring in 2024. It will remain uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, ranked by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal, or (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves positively if either of the following occurs: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson competing on the following days: Women's 100m on Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, and Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced) on Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) and ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, either (a) Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal, or (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if at least one of the following happens: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson earns a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field competitions are scheduled to begin on Thursday, August 1, and wrap up on Sunday, August 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson participating on the following dates: Women's 100m from Friday, August 2, to Saturday, August 3, and Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups yet to be determined) on Thursday, August 8, to Friday, August 9. (b) France ranks within the top 5 of the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by counting the total number of medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on: 1. Total Gold Medals, 2. (In case of a tie) Total Silver Medals, 3. (In case of a tie) Total Bronze Medals. The inquiry will be resolved affirmatively if France ranks in the top 5 (ties are resolved positively) and will be uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris select either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP (YES), or choose someone else (NO)?
para_P.body:
Currently, the leading candidates for Kamala's vice presidential nomination are Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. Reports indicate that Kamala will make her decision before August 7th.

This market will resolve to YES if Kamala Harris announces her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market will resolve to NO if Kamala Harris selects any other individual as her running mate.

I will wait for Kamala to confirm her choice before resolving this.

Feel free to comment if you have any questions or updates 💙

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20, or Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. This question resolves to NO if neither of these events occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw before July 20, or that Kamala Harris will choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her running mate?
para_P.body: This inquiry results in a YES if one of the following happens: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue in the race prior to July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris reveals her selection for vice president as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself. This inquiry results in a NO if neither of these scenarios takes place.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and as **No** for any other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied for the number of seats, both will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 elections for the European Parliament?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and a **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both related inquiries will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two or more groups are tied for the most seats, this question will resolve as **Yes** if either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA is among those groups. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: After the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event that two or more factions are tied for the highest seat count, this question will also resolve as **Yes** if either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA is included among those tied groups. The resolution of this question is based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Australia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Australia fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Australia or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Australia nor Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Australia or Latvia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Australia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Australia nor Latvia progresses, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat assessed in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A, and will stay open until their closing time regardless of circumstances.
