question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024? Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat in opposition to Biden, or (b) the USD reaches a value of at least 145 JPY at the end of trading on August 9th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote for Joe Biden in a theoretical scenario, while the other seeks votes for a generic Democrat in a similar situation. This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or greater upon their closure. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference calculated from poll 1 and poll 2 is equal to or exceeds 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

(b) Will the USD be valued at 145 JPY or more when trading concludes on August 9th, 2024? The market resolution will be based on the USD/JPY closing rate as reported on Yahoo! Finance for August 9th, 2024.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be named President by Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, the market will end with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be taken into account.

Resolver

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this resolves to "No". The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) another presidential debate for the Democratic party takes place before the 2024 Convention (b) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO in other cases.

(b) This will be marked as "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will be marked as "No". The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 4 but not surpassing 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and does not exceed 5, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period of July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm record a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 5 but is 6 or lower?

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 4 but is at most 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and does not surpass 6, as per the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 3 and up to 4 points in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive score of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be included later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 election; the outcome is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Details for (a): For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Details for (b): This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 but does not exceed 4 on July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. 

Clarification for (a): In this context, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, this would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

Clarification for (b): This question is not limited to the candidates listed below; other candidates may be included later. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news organization report the incident no less than 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% advantage among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests their choice of a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Do the Manifold participants reflect the broader public? 

This market will be resolved with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. 

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump give testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, or will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(1) Will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat? This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. The first poll includes Joe Biden, and the second includes a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more, this part resolves YES. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This combined question resolves YES if either (1) or (2) resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will Trump achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents against Biden, or will he take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(1) Is it possible for Donald Trump to secure at least 3% additional votes among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden compared to a standard Democrat? This will be determined by two Manifold polls concluding on July 6. The first poll features Joe Biden, while the second includes a standard Democrat. If Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second by 3% or more, this part will be considered YES. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial? This will be considered YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial regarding the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

The overall question will be deemed YES if either (1) or (2) is answered YES.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the nomination for President from the Democratic Party?

This will resolve identically to the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

A Yes resolution will occur if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the specified date, this part will resolve as No.

The resolution of this combined question depends on the resolution of either part (a) or part (b) as described above.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden makes an announcement prior to July 15, 2024, indicating he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the subsequent events takes place:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the decision of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, declaring that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the specified date, this component will resolve as No.

The outcome of this combined question hinges on the resolution of either part (a) or part (b) as outlined above.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

The resolution will be based on the data found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

question.title: Will either the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July or Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and causes the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% in July or that Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase exceeding 0.1% in comparison to June 2024, utilizing the specific figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to assert that "the President cannot fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and subsequently allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not applicable.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently under consideration; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

This is determined solely by the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of any other candidates or the nominee on the day of the election. (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If neither of these events occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

This decision is made solely by the delegates at the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other contenders or the nominee on election day. (b) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his presidential campaign before midnight Central Time on July 13. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the inquiry will resolve with a **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Will there be an authorized referendum in Scotland concerning independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if an official referendum takes place in Scotland about its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be of an "advisory" nature; it is not required for the referendum to have any legal binding consequences.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of vote where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the referendum, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. The referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump is officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any potential reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, or (b) Trump is removed from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The condition will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, or (b) Trump is disqualified from a primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be answered with yes if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, the answer will be no.

(b) The answer will be "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for a positive resolution. The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that might take place after this date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified from any ballot, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be an announcement from Joe Biden before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, either Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, and official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia possess Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) displays the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E categorized under any of the following:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the location is not classified in any of the categories that denote Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control of the area.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories indicating Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or that Russia will gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept his party's nomination for a subsequent term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications signifying Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other classifications established by ISW that denote Russian authority over the area.

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

By "accessible," it is meant that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (although it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as it was in Italy in early 2023), or not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be positive if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) The question about OpenAI resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing the outcomes from an external safety red-team evaluation of their models by June 30, 2024, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) For Inflection, this question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *publicly accessible* report with findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models. (b) The inquiry concerning OpenAI will resolve as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without the need for a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that over 50% of the population can use it. Here, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news source report the story a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. 

Coverage from local news, conspiracy theory websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be considered adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is determined to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election relative to Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will settle at a 50-50 outcome.

The resolution will reference FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are accessible. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will NOT be factored into the resolution.

question.title: Will either Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source for this is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Francis Suarez will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that FiveThirtyEight will indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Francis Suarez is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date for this market. If any of these scenarios occur, the answer will be **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, or (b) the domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpasses $185,548,391?
para_P.body:
(a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine. This will be considered YES if she appears in any capacity, including voice work for a character. It will also be counted as YES if she is not listed on IMDB, provided that independent sources confirm her appearance. 

(b) The domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This will resolve in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus and is based on the data from Boxofficemojo on the film's page. Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be applied to this market automatically.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the upcoming 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed, as additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, the individual who ultimately receives the Republican nomination on election day in 2024 is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden withdraws prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) This component of the inquiry will yield a **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any alternative candidate being chosen will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently known; additional options may emerge later. The outcome is strictly based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This component of the inquiry will yield a **Yes** if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20 at midnight Eastern Time. If not, it will result in a **No**.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses that of Apple on July 17, 2024, as reported by Companies Market Cap, when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 17, 2024: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, or (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs:

1. On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The question resolves No if neither of these conditions is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by July 17, 2024, either Nvidia's market value surpasses that of Apple, or Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if one of the following situations occurs:

1. On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds that of Apple, as reported by Companies Market Cap, verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. Confirmation of the disqualification or barring must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position on the grounds mentioned as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered negatively.

The question will be answered negatively if neither of these scenarios occurs.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data published by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by their specified dates, either (1) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) shows an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure signifies a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the value noted for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(2) This question will be resolved based on data from the St. Louis Fed available here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must be higher than the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

If not, the question will be deemed **No**.
