question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to enforce the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
question.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant group) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
Source of resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators who express this before midnight Central Time on July 20, the outcome will be yes. If not, it will be no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) At any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

If neither of these occurs, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to step down prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) The Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) Before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are requesting Biden to withdraw.

If neither scenario occurs, then this question will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This will conclude with a Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. It will conclude with a No if either the men's or women's team does not finish in first place.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be answered with **No** if any other team wins, as they would then be the ones in contention.

question.title: Will either Team USA win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No if neither condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Team USA to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or for the Philadelphia 76ers to clinch the 2024 NBA Finals?

It will result in a No if neither scenario occurs.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public pledge to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are met:

- OpenAI makes a public pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the organization or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement can be formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a remark in an interview). The declaration from OpenAI must signify a new commitment to the principle in question, compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply repeat that, for instance, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the organization has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their level of contentment with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as stringent as "this was a good first step" for this inquiry to conclude with **Yes**.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
   - OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Pandemic Agreement will gain approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, or will OpenAI make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. The Pandemic Agreement is voted on and approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by reliable sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, both of the following statements hold true:
   - OpenAI makes a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" through a declaration from the company or a spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. This declaration can take the form of a formal announcement (like a press release) or an informal one (such as a tweet or a quote from an interview). The statement must show a new level of commitment to this principle compared to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was made; it cannot simply repeat that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one individual associated with righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or endorsers to evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for the question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 24 global records be surpassed at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the count of world records surpassed during the Paris Olympic Games reaches 24 or more.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the Top 5 in the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In cases of a tie for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In cases of a tie for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by total number of medals and ordered by number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, either (a) a minimum of 24 world records will be shattered or (b) France will secure a position in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following happens during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) 24 or more world records are established. (b) France achieves a Top 5 ranking in the medal standings, which are determined by the total count of medals and prioritized by Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The outcome of this question becomes unclear if the Olympics are not held in 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in support between Trump and Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This sub-question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this sub-question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

This sub-question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen by the deadline, this sub-question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following takes place prior to their deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government terminates its contract with Verisign for the management of the .com TLD?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This sub-question will be answered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, this sub-question will be answered No.

(b) Will the US government discontinue its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

This sub-question will be answered Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not occur by the deadline, this sub-question will be answered No.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently discussed; additional possibilities may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to conclude on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to cast their votes with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other presents a generic Democrat for voting.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the error margin. Are the opinions of Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will be resolved as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the first poll's formula and the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) In the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is greater than or equal to 0.03, this part of the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump Jr. will be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will Trump achieve at least a 3% higher support among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat against Joe Biden?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations occurs: (a) The Republican National Convention selects Donald Trump Jr. as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by the nominee chosen on election day. (b) According to the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is at least 0.03, then this part of the question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be determined by the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, resulting in a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question. (b) This will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following individuals becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Reliable users are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party anticipated?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves as YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as described, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or that there will be another Democratic presidential debate?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This is considered a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, official announcement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Will there be an additional Democratic presidential debate? This is considered YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It is NO otherwise.

This overall question is answered with YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as outlined, or (b) there is another Democratic presidential debate as described.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)

question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) experience an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. The possibility of new candidates emerging in the future is also taken into account.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the day of the election.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater than it was a year prior, or will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if one of the following takes place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, surpasses its value from July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) The Republican National Convention designates Donald Trump as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of other candidates or the ultimate nominee on election day.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Google DeepMind will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models regarding safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered as **YES** if they make a *public* report available by June 30, 2024, which includes the findings from an *external* entity assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to everyone in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

The term "accessible to everyone" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is the ability to use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that over 50% of the population can access it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing findings from an external safety evaluation of their models, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be marked as **YES** if they issue a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showing the outcomes from an *independent* evaluation of one of their AI models' safety.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be marked as **YES** if it is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in some EU nations, or not accessible to certain demographics (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general online interface for engaging with GPT models and will be considered positively even if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. Additional candidates may be included in the future beyond those currently listed.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 3 but not surpass 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and does not depend on who is announced as the nominee on election day. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, according to the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure reflects a lead for Trump.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia possess Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, when checked by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains Within the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if the location is not classified under any categories that suggest Russian control, which includes, but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories established by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, or Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

1. When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

   The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

   The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Russia gain control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024, or will Donald Trump be disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs:

1. On June 1, 2024, when examined by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall under any of these classifications:
   - Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
   - Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Evaluated Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area

   The inquiry will be answered with **No** if the area is not classified under any category that suggests Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:
   - Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours
   - Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
   - Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
   - Any other classifications created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

2. By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring is validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution.

   The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in a **No** for any other teams as they will be ruled out of the competition.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for any other teams that do not succeed in the championship.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship and they are both eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks to emerge victorious in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will result in **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will result in **No** if both teams fail to secure the championship and are eliminated from the race.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court make any arrest warrants for the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in the absence of such warrants.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is a terrorist incident expected to take place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the dates of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be No if this scenario does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any governmental body of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for certain Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) the ICC will issue arrest warrants for specific Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist incident transpires in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli government figures: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). It will be marked as **No** otherwise.

(b) This inquiry will be marked as Yes if a terrorist act in Metropolitan France results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). It will be marked as No if this does not occur. An event will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is labeled as such by any French State agency, or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Are Malta or Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Slovenia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based exclusively on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the trial related to the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
