question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump outpaces Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a 45-minute or longer live interview before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he engaged in a discussion for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve as YES, Biden must take part in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no such interview is available by the market's closing at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are part of programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50-minute video could potentially only contain 20 minutes of Biden in an interview, which would not be sufficient. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all featured less than 30 minutes of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will determine the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) The latest qualifying interview occurred during Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. Should Biden engage in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. However, it may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be valid. A 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying. For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. A list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts can be found here.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie in seats between two groups, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 designate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is determined to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve as a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the likelihood of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is Tim Scott going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

Regarding part (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its data will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution will refer to the probabilities of each candidate winning expressed as a percentage out of 100 rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The count of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Will a tennis player secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if any tennis player earns a minimum of two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) clinch gold in the following eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, if the same NOC manages to win at least two of these competitions, the question will resolve as **Yes**.

The resolution of the question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will take place (for instance, if neither team competing in the final of the last event has achieved victory in any of the previous events).

question.title: Will either an athlete win multiple tennis medals or a nation win multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same nation wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Will a competitor secure multiple medals in tennis or will a country achieve gold in various women's team sports during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: 

(a) An athlete is awarded two or more medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) A single country claims gold in more than one of these women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This will be considered **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) each win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the difference in support for Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's advantage, while a negative figure suggests Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Trump has a lead over Biden that is more than 3 but at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is fulfilled: (a) Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as decided exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is recorded as exceeding 3 and being no more than 4, as viewed on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 but not surpass 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, or (b) the Greens–EFA will secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) Is Trump's margin over Biden expected to be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538? This inquiry will determine the outcome based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, if the value on July 5, 2024, shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, this would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) Will the Greens–EFA emerge with the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction has the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be **No** for any other result. In the event of a tie between two groups for the number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these criteria are met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate publicly express their opposition to the early nomination strategy, or will there be a contested convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st, a public statement against the early nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators. It is also acceptable if several letters together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party needs more than one voting round in its roll call to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither condition is satisfied, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Francis Suarez be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Francis Suarez is appointed by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently under discussion; additional possibilities may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur for the 2024 US Presidential Election: (a) Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee, or (b) Democrats have a brokered convention?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this part resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that for the 2024 US Presidential Election, either (a) Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee, or (b) the Democrats face a brokered convention?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) The Republican National Convention chooses Francis Suarez as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the delegates' selection. (b) The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in their roll call ballot to officially nominate their candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this part will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a political coalition formed between Les Républicains and the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative elections?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if an official announcement regarding an electoral collaboration or coalition agreement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) is made before June 30, 2024, as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not made, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is the Prime Minister of France part of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the Prime Minister of France's party is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 30, 2024: (a) The Republican Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: By July 30, 2024, will one of the following take place: (a) The French Republican Party collaborates politically with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France (b) The Prime Minister of France is affiliated with the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) An official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republican Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made before June 30, 2024, based on reliable sources. If such an agreement is not announced, this part will conclude as **No**. (b) As of July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, as reported by credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be resolved as **Yes**. If neither is satisfied, it will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 3 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the graph for the date of July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to candidates not currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this matter, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Will either of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538, or (b) will Larry Elder be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and at most 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive result indicates a Trump lead, while a negative result signifies Biden is ahead.
(b) This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than by who is nominated on election day.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A Republican legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 or (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered a **Yes** if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count. Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position. 

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should not allow for any interpretation that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is a Woman Going to be the Democratic Presidential Nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered resolved as “yes” when a female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

It will be deemed resolved as “no” when the Democratic delegates select a male candidate for the presidential nomination in the 2024 election.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, if the same NOC wins at least two of these competitions, the inquiry will be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

The question will resolve as NO if neither (a) nor (b) occurs. Specifically, (a) will resolve as NO if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and (b) will resolve as NO if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate to be a Woman or for one country to secure victories in multiple women's team events at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential candidate for the 2024 election. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold medals in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, which comprise association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

Conversely, the question will be considered NO if neither (a) nor (b) happens. Specifically, (a) will be NO if the Democratic delegates nominate a male candidate for the 2024 election, and (b) will be NO if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following happens: (a) According to Nate Silver's model, Kamala's chances of winning improve over the next week, (b) Joe Biden makes a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain in office until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will determine a yes outcome if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim hampers the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman expressed in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of any letter.

This market will determine a YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice. If neither condition is met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president by the conclusion of July 2024, or will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members publicly endorse a letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of time?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Joe Biden is still the recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is endorsed by no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who align with the Democratic Party. It is also acceptable if multiple letters together contain a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If neither of these scenarios happens, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic Party will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, then this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they claim suppresses the ongoing vigorous discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend’s attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite troubled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and perhaps achieve unity through sheer force, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He opted not to verify the letter's existence.

This market will conclude with a YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, if multiple letters collectively bearing 20 lawmakers' signatures are presented, it would also result in a YES resolution for this market. 

Conversely, if these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves as **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then this will be marked as **No**.

(b) A minimum of 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden early: This will be marked as **Yes** if at least 20 members of the House or Senate who are part of the Democratic caucus sign a public letter against the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Additionally, multiple letters that together have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, it will be marked as NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to support a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically assessed performs either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never result in N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. The advantage must be greater than 2 and at most 4.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran engage in military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will determine a "Yes" outcome if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

For this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zones (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is publicly recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not be considered in the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian land will be taken into account for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

For the purposes of this component, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this component will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this component.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this component. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this component.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military operation against Israel prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if either of the following situations arises: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) announce that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in-person or virtually, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zone between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. 

For this aspect, a "military operation" is defined as any forceful action taken by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime zone (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot located in Israel, this aspect will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers will not contribute to the resolution of this aspect.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian land, will be counted for the resolution of this aspect. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this aspect.

question.title: Will Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Finland to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Finland competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Finland fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.
