question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final price of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 77,000?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry is based on the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will resolve as **No**. This inquiry may take into account new candidates who might emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, or (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.

(b) Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) The BSE SENSEX's closing figure will be over 75,000 but not exceed 77,000 on July 21, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will be the Republican candidate for the US Presidential Election in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) On July 21, 2024, the BSE SENSEX's closing figure, as reported by Yahoo Finance, will exceed 75,000 and will not be more than 77,000.

(b) The Republican National Convention will choose Donald Trump as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates are viewed as equally likely to win, this market will resolve at a rate of 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may not resolve until the figures for July 20 are released. Should there be no available data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the chances of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden fall between 2 and 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will 538 either show Biden as the frontrunner, or will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (1) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This will be assessed using the blue and red trend lines displayed on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ once data points for July 20 are accessible. If data points for July 19 are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding numbers to July 19 will be utilized. (2) On July 15, 2024, the difference in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election shows that Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 4 points, as indicated on the chart when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?

If neither event occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Francis Suarez becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following situations takes place: (a) Francis Suarez is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the nominee on election day. (b) Before midnight Central Time on July 20, if 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to step aside, based on the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If neither of these scenarios occurs, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 consider Biden the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a better chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates possess equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will refer to FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically relying on the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 becomes accessible. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August or 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This resolves to YES if Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, or that the 538 projections will show Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent entity) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Any departure from the presidency by Biden through death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024. This will be answered affirmatively if FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election on July 19, 2024, indicates Joe Biden as the leading candidate over Donald Trump. If both candidates have equal chances, the resolution will be 50-50. The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, specifically the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will be based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, this will also resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources. If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will be classified as **Yes** if the ID political faction has the most seats. If two factions are equal in the number of seats, it will also be classified as **Yes**. The determination will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media sources. (b) The Pandemic Agreement is ratified through a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by credible outlets. If either (a) or (b) happens, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To be considered a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Further details and additional context can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question is resolved, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for early resolution requests or to report any issues.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If neither of these events occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This inquiry will be regarded as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Elon Musk appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump be removed from a primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Elon Musk will participate in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event or that Donald Trump will be disqualified from a primary election ballot due to the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Elon Musk appears as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is among the largest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion columns, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position on the specified basis as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests participants to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion regularly indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in a hypothetical scenario is either leading or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will remain available until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly requested Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they no longer believe Biden can win in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of them would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will conclude with a YES if a collective of at least five named Democratic US House Members or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. Merely five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Any reports of an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, or (b) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump increases his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat, or (b) at least five named Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?
para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are scheduled to close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot. This question will be answered with YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the calculation for the first poll minus the calculation for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

(b) This market will be resolved as YES if a coalition of at least five specific Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through a signed letter or through a collective conversation with Biden where they jointly ask him to step aside. It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective communication. Five individuals independently informing reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw does not qualify for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden requesting him to step aside will not fulfill the criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are mentioned but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, the market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden either withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican party in the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be deemed **No**. This question is open to the inclusion of additional candidates in the future, beyond those currently listed.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden either withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, 2024. (b) The Republican National Convention chooses Mike Pence as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the inquiry will be considered **No**.

question.title: Will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Denmark set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Denmark competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Denmark fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Poland or Denmark qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Denmark qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Poland or Denmark make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Denmark competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Poland nor Denmark advances, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Philadelphia 76ers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Orlando Magic to become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will either the Philadelphia 76ers or the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

para_P.title: Will there be a new Moana attraction revealed by Disney for Magic Kingdom during D23 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered YES if Disney reveals a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. It will be deemed NO if it is mentioned in a brainstorming context similar to how some attractions were discussed at the last D23. It will also be NO if a Moana attraction is announced for another theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will close on August 8, the day before the event. The outcome will be determined after the event.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.title: Will the crossover of Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend in history for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The movie, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its opening weekend. This would set a new record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film. In the domestic market, the film is expected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the all-time highest R-rated opening.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film belongs to the original Deadpool, which earned $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will this new film exceed these figures? It seems likely to be very close...

It will certainly be screened in more theaters... Deadpool was a phenomenal success at the time, and somewhat unexpected.

Given that BoxOfficeMojo has a peculiar way of reporting international opening weekends — it presents the raw figures but aggregates them oddly — we will wait for the Hollywood Reporter to confirm what the weekend's opening total was.

To clarify the resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or an equivalent publication) acknowledges it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be regarded as unofficial until there's verification in the Hollywood press. And the target number we are aiming for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will either a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom be announced at D23 2024 or Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention. (b) "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The film is directed by Shawn Levy and stars Ryan Reynolds. The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that a new Moana attraction for Magic Kingdom will be revealed during D23 2024 or that Deadpool & Wolverine will achieve the highest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following happens: (a) Disney unveils a new Moana-themed attraction for the Magic Kingdom in Florida at or prior to the D23 event in August 2024. It will be marked NO if it is merely talked about in a speculative manner, akin to previous discussions about attractions at earlier D23 events. It will also be marked NO if a Moana attraction is disclosed for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting will conclude on August 8, the day before the event, and the outcome will be determined after the event. (b) "Deadpool x Wolverine" earns over $284.5 million worldwide during its opening weekend, as reported by sources such as the Hollywood Reporter (or similar outlets), and is recognized as the record holder for an R-rated film's release. The film is directed by Shawn Levy and features Ryan Reynolds. The current record for the highest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool at $284.5 million ($152.2 million domestically).

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be answered with **No** for any other results. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question depends on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible" in this context means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require a payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), the question will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The question will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either the Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same. The question resolves as **No** if neither of these occur.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections or will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The Greens–EFA political faction achieves the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources. (b) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) becomes widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024. "Widely accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to access it without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations or to specific demographics, it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" pertains to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models and will be positively resolved if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same. The question will be marked as **No** if neither of these conditions is met.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on June 28th, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Nvidia's market capitalization surpasses Apple's on June 28, 2024, as per the data from [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

Details 

I will rely on the precision provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, without decimals).

The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for reference only (as far as I know, it requires a score of 75% or higher on the Tomatometer, but there may be additional criteria—the market resolves based solely on the score displayed).

"Twisters" (2024) serves as a standalone sequel to the original film from 1996, directed by Lee Isaac Chung (known for "Minari"), featuring Glen Powell (from "Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones (from "Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.body:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th). For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes, but the market resolves solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office opening will be reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either "Twisters" (2024) to achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of 75% or more, or for "Deadpool & Wolverine" to surpass the domestic box office opening of both "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) receives a Rotten Tomatoes critics rating of at least 75% one week post-release (July 26th). The rating will be sourced from the "Twisters" (2024) page on Rotten Tomatoes, using the exact percentage provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually a whole number, no decimals). For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) currently holds a Tomatometer of 63%. The term "Certified Fresh" is mentioned for context, but the resolution will depend solely on the score displayed. "Twisters" (2024) is an independent sequel to the 1996 film, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening of **Deadpool & Wolverine** exceeds $185,548,391, which is the total of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office figures will be provided by Boxofficemojo on the respective movie's page.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the recorded value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 21 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This market will be deemed "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will be considered "No". 

Should it be verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will instantly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, either (a) a tennis player secures more than one medal, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Any tennis player earns two or more medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) The total gold medals won by Individual Neutral Athletes reaches 21 or exceeds that number during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution for (b) will rely on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reputable sources in case the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden fall between 2 and 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as depicted on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Vice President for the Democrats?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if Kamala Harris receives the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency. Conversely, if a different individual is appointed as VP, the market will conclude with a no. Any subsequent changes to the Vice Presidency after the original nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The resolution can occur right after the nomination.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will resolve as YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this will resolve as NO. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will conclude as YES if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the data accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will conclude as YES if Kamala Harris is appointed as the Democratic Vice President. If another individual is chosen as Vice President, this will conclude as NO. The resolution hinges on the original nomination and will remain unchanged if the Vice President is altered for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will be resolved as YES if Biden engages in another such in-person interview that lasts a minimum of 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market does not consider press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in person for these appearances to be valid. For instance, a 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.
