para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) based on the data for July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, OR (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person is required for it to count.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden engages in an in-person interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, OR (b) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will participate in an in-person interview or discussion on camera for more than 45 minutes before July 2024 ends. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs such as 60 Minutes, but does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. A minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in person is necessary for it to qualify.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 based on 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election in 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. This will be verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Ron DeSantis going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election. The determination is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through end of July 2024 or Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to hold the presidency until the end of July 2024, or for Ron DeSantis to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if one of the following situations arises: (a) Biden continues as the US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed negative if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to an affirmative resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution.) (b) Ron DeSantis is named the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will result in a negative outcome. This question is not limited to those candidates currently mentioned; additional candidates may be introduced later. For this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the competitor who earns the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in the swimming competitions.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.body: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these situations will happen during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer achieves the highest count of gold medals (b) Five or more nations secure their first Olympic gold medal?
para_P.body: (a) The competitor who earns the greatest number of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) At least five nations claim their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on reliable reports.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion surrounding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly concerned about the prospects of Biden's candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or (2) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: 

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(2) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election:

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following happens: (1) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early, or (2) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early: 

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they claim suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker participating in the initiative.

A drafted letter, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refused to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by market close, this market resolves to NO.

(2) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election:

This question will be marked as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will five or more nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their initial Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve 15 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will be determined as "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if IOC reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will either at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will at least five nations secure their first gold medal or will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Five or more nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, as reported by reliable sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as confirmed by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. Should it be established that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this condition will immediately resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is independent of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Electoral College probability for Kamala Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Links for reference:

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Ted Cruz will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Kamala's chances of winning will improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's predictions?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who is nominated as the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The likelihood of Kamala Harris winning, according to Nate Silver's model, exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as **No** otherwise.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024 indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be answered as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. You may contact @jskf to request an early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

For Liz Cheney, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For Joe Biden, to qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Liz Cheney will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

Regarding Liz Cheney, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For Joe Biden, to achieve a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any uncertainty about Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this portion of the question will be answered as No.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the French Prime Minister be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the French Prime Minister's party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be answered with **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied in seat count, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

This question is determined based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable news sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following scenarios takes place: (a) The French Prime Minister is affiliated with a party other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024, or (b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the political party of the French Prime Minister is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

(b) This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the ID political faction has the majority of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be a No for any other political factions. In the event of a tie between two groups for seats, both sub-questions will be answered with Yes.

This inquiry will be resolved based on official declarations from the European Parliament or trustworthy media outlets.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

- Recent M. Night Shyamalan films have received CinemaScores ranging from C to B+.
